page.title: 16Recreation & Tourism
page.content: Recreation is limited to walking and fishing which in turn are tourist attractions. The summer sees tourists in the area for the beautiful scenery and peace. In a minor way cycling and horse riding take place. Local footpaths have been signposted by the Council to encourage walking. An old flour mill & bakery has been renovated & is an attraction as a restaurant. Some people follow recreational pursuits out of the area. There are darts & pool teams at local pubs. Gliding is taught on the old airfield at Strubby which is also a heliport. Kart racing also takes place. The caravan park at Woodthorpe provides a 9 hole golf course, fishing, bowling & swimming in an open air pool. There aare sometimes artists in this area painting in both oil and watercolour.
